name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: "Trump and others aligned with his message know that once people understand slavery’s entanglement in every facet of U.S. history, the legitimacy of its systems unravels—and with it, the legitimacy of those occupying the spaces of power.” —@ClintSmithIII https://t.co/vSwS2Mawt3

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: Wouldn't court packing just mean an endless zig zag pattern of adding new justices every time a new party is in power? Wouldn't it ... eventually degrade the Court's legitimacy? 

I asked @TakeBacktheCt's @AaronBelkin these questions. Here's what he said:

https://t.co/d2zZ1LhAFo

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Most likely, your future is also brighter than what you may think at your darkest moments, so dispute your pessimism not with mindless optimism, but with facts."

As usual, great advice from @arthurbrooks (via @TheAtlantic):
https://t.co/H7x3ItXxbE

name: TheAtlantic
text: For years, the Gates Foundation has documented gradual progress in public health—fewer children dying, less malnutrition, longer life spans. But COVID-19 has set back the world dramatically, @BillGates said in an interview with @edyong209: https://t.co/BI98UqOh64

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pessimism and a sense of powerlessness about the future are a near-perfect cocktail for misery. During the pandemic, it’s not just one person's future that feels bleak; it's all of ours. In "How to Build a Life," @arthurbrooks offers advice on how to cope: https://t.co/L9hrlWTnab

name: TheAtlantic
text: Related: If we lean into times of transition instead of resisting them, they can be seasons of great growth, @arthurbrooks wrote earlier this month. https://t.co/tjYNncxuF7

name: TheAtlantic
text: If the vote is close, Donald Trump could easily throw the election into chaos and subvert the result. Join @AdrienneLaF and @bartongellman at #TheAtlanticFest for a conversation about Gellman’s latest cover story and our potentially turbulent future. https://t.co/hX1nRCwEEl

name: TheAtlantic
text: Democrats' path to a Senate majority may be much easier if they can keep the Supreme Court debate focused on the Affordable Care Act, writes @RonBrownstein. https://t.co/GDO3OrfPff

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @TheAtlanticFest: Trump's Election Day strategy is not one of someone who thinks he will win. - @bartongellman at #TheAtlanticFest.

Read his November cover story here: https://t.co/UTKyZLnmxZ https://t.co/APUKLRoOds

name: TheAtlantic
